intro: Hieracium breviusculum, commonly known as the short-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium breviusculum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
